result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank L Panagis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs.
10/07/2015 PER MOTION HEARING COURT GRANTS DEFENDANT TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for HFM Packaging to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision before costs or fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. No Contact with HFM Packaging or Boy Scout Troop 28. (Agent may approve contact with Boy Scout Troop 28). Maintain employment and/or school combination. Not to engage in any activity or employment involving any kind of access to financial accounts, checkbooks, etc. Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

from Dept of Corrections advising defendant has completed Wisconsin Drug Abuse Program/Earned Release Program, with attached order for signature.
Dated 10/15/15, from DOC to Judge Carter, requesting amendment of JOC to clarify date committed.
Dated 10/08/15, from Atty Bailey to Judge Carter, advising that his client does not wish to file a notice of appeal and is asking that the case status on this matter be changed to closed.
Amended form - adding Defendant's eligibility for substance abuse program

Defendant Frank L Panagis appears by videoconference from Sturdevandt Transitional Facility, in custody.  Attorney Chris Bailey appears on behalf of Defendant.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is sworn-in and testifies.  Attorney Bailey requests that Defendant be eligible for substance abuse program and questions Defendant regarding such request.  Cross-examination by the state.  Attorney Bailey makes closing statements.  State makes statements.  Victim, John R.,  makes statements.  Court finds there is no new factor presented today to modify sentence and denies request.  Court does grant request for defendant to be eligible for substance abuse programming.  Amended judgment of conviction to be prepared to relect such change.
Motion hearing at 10-07-2015 08:30 am
Motion hearing on September 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frank L Panagis in court with Attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  John R. makes statements.  Christina P. makes statements.  Attorney Kohn makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

 8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  4 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: HFM Packaging or Boy Scout Troop 28 (unless approved by agent for Boy Scout Troop 28)  
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)
____Not to engage in any activity or employment involving any kind of access to financial accounts, checkbooks, etc.  
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  $238,236.46 to HFM Packaging (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)


COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  8 YEARS       **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: HFM Packaging or Boy Scout Troop 28 (unless approved by agent for Boy Scout Troop 28)  
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)
____Not to engage in any activity or employment involving any kind of access to financial accounts, checkbooks, etc.  
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

 COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #3:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  8 YEARS       **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: HFM Packaging or Boy Scout Troop 28 (unless approved by agent for Boy Scout Troop 28)  
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)
____Not to engage in any activity or employment involving any kind of access to financial accounts, checkbooks, etc.  
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

 COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on January 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frank L Panagis in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files amended information. Defendant enters guilty plea to counts #1, 2, & 7 of amended information. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of counts #1, 2, & 7 on amended information. Counts #3-6 of amended information are dismissed and read in. Atty Kohn requests a Pre Sentence Investigation. Court orders Pre Sentence Investigation. Bail remains as fixed. Court sets matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
